column5: SHANGHAI  Aug 8 Executives at Toyota Motor Corp  said the Chinese government is taking an "initial" look into the auto parts policies of its premium brand Lexus as regulators conduct probes into possible monopoly behaviour across the industry.

column4: Toyota to start U.S. sales of Lexus NX compact SUV in November -exec
column5: MIYAWAKA  Japan  Aug 8 Toyota Motor Corp's  luxury brand Lexus will start selling its new NX compact SUV in the United States from November and aims to sell 42 000 of the SUVs annually in Lexus's biggest market  an executive said on Friday.

column4: High-grade shrugs off high-yield bond woes
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 8 (IFR) - Why a company like Tyson Foods will jump through hoops to keep an investment-grade rating was made blindingly clear last week  when the high-grade new-issue market shrugged off mayhem in the junk bond market and priced almost US$23bn of deals.

column4: BRIEF-Taiwan's UMC posts 0.14 pct fall in July sales
column5: * says July sales at T$11.5 bln(383.33 million US dollar)

column4: Boeing  United Technologies stock up titanium parts from Russia: WSJ
column5: Boeing and United Technologies have been amassing titanium parts from Russian producer VSMPO-Avisma in case tensions between the United States and Russia disrupt supply of the metal critical to building jetliners  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing an industry official familiar with the plans.

column4: Boeing  United Technologies stock up titanium parts from Russia - WSJ
column5: Aug 8 Boeing and United Technologies have been amassing titanium parts from Russian producer VSMPO-Avisma  in case tensions between the United States and Russia disrupt supply of the metal critical to building jetliners  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing an industry official familiar with the plans.

column4: California judge sets August 20 hearing in Allergan vs. Valeant case
column5: The federal judge in California overseeing Allergan Inc's  insider trading lawsuit against Valeant Pharmaceuticals  and activist investor William Ackman has set an Aug. 20 hearing date to decide on a fast-track schedule for the case  according to court documents.

column4: California judge sets Aug. 20 hearing in Allergan vs Valeant case
column5: Aug 8 The federal judge in California overseeing Allergan Inc's insider trading lawsuit against Valeant Pharmaceuticals and activist investor William Ackman has set an Aug. 20 hearing date to decide on a fast-track schedule for the case  according to court documents.

column4: San Francisco man gets 3 months in Marvel insider trading case
column5: Aug 7 A 29-year-old San Francisco man was sentenced to three months in federal prison on Thursday after he pleaded guilty to insider trading ahead of news that Marvel Entertainment Inc would be bought by Walt Disney Co.

column4: U.S. meat supplier OSI withdraws products made in Shanghai factory
column5: HONG KONG U.S. meat supplier OSI Group LLC [OSIGP.UL] is withdrawing products made in a Shanghai factory from undisclosed outlets in the wake of a food safety scare last month that hit fast food chains McDonald's and Yum Brands Inc's KFC.
